title: 1971–72 British Home Championship
text:
The 1971–72 <a href="British%20Home%20Championship">British Home Championship</a> was the first such <a href="Home%20Nations">Home Nations</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> tournament (although not the last), to suffer during <a href="The%20Troubles">The Troubles</a> in Northern Ireland, when death threats from the <a href="Provisional%20Irish%20Republican%20Army">Provisional Irish Republican Army</a> were sent to the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20Association">Scottish Football Association</a> and <a href="Scotland%20national%20football%20team">Scottish</a> players who were scheduled to play at <a href="Windsor%20Park">Windsor Park</a>. The surge in anti-British feeling which prompted these threats followed <a href="Bloody%20Sunday%20%281972%29">Bloody Sunday</a> in January, and also resulted in the cancellation of the <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> <a href="1972%20Five%20Nations%20Championship">1972 Five Nations Championship</a>. As a result, <a href="Northern%20Ireland%20national%20football%20team">Northern Ireland's</a> home fixture was rescheduled to <a href="Hampden%20Park">Hampden Park</a>, effectively granting the Scottish team an extra home match. This was not the last time that The Troubles would interfere with the Home Championship; the <a href="1981%20British%20Home%20Championship">1981 British Home Championship</a> would have to be abandoned following similar heightened tension after the death of <a href="Bobby%20Sands">Bobby Sands</a>.
Scotland used their home advantage well, securing victory over the Irish and <a href="Wales%20national%20football%20team">Welsh</a> to take a major points advantage into the final match against England, who had lost at home to Northern Ireland following a heavy defeat of Wales. In the last match however, <a href="England%20national%20football%20team">England</a> gained a slight advantage over their old rivals, winning 1–0 and thus equalling the tournament on points and resulting in a shared victory (<a href="goal%20difference">goal difference</a> was not at this stage used to differentiate between teams). The Welsh salvaged a point in their final home game to Northern Ireland, but still finished bottom of the table.
